Subsection.Text: Except as provided in subsection (2), in any action to which this part applies in which the trier of fact determines that liability exists on the part of the defendant, the trier of fact shall, as a part of the verdict, itemize the amounts to be awarded to the claimant into the following categories of damages:

Paragraph.Text: Amounts intended to compensate the claimant for economic losses;
Amounts intended to compensate the claimant for noneconomic losses; and
Amounts awarded to the claimant for punitive damages, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: In any action for damages based on personal injury or wrongful death arising out of medical malpractice, whether in tort or contract, to which this part applies in which the trier of fact determines that liability exists on the part of the defendant, the trier of fact shall, as a part of the verdict, itemize the amounts to be awarded to the claimant into the following categories of damages:

Paragraph.Text: Amounts intended to compensate the claimant for:

SubParagraph.Text: Future economic losses, not reduced to present value, and the number of years or part thereof which the award is intended to cover;

Paragraph.Text: Amounts intended to compensate the claimant for:

SubParagraph.Text: Future noneconomic losses and the number of years or part thereof which the award is intended to cover; and

Paragraph.Text: Amounts awarded to the claimant for punitive damages, if applicable.
